alert.note: Alert for Cass; Itasca (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 18 at 9:35AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CDT TODAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of north central Minnesota, including the following counties, Cass and Itasca. * WHEN...Until noon CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 935 AM CDT, the public reported flooding in the advisory area. Minor flooding is already occurring. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bena, Lake Winnibigoshish, Leech Lake, Portage Lake, Dixon Lake, Cut Foot Sioux Lake and Schley. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
